image.altText: A man wearing a maroon hoodie sits at a table looking serious.

props.synopsis: Royalla residents and the local mayor want to halt plans to transform an empty field over their back fence into a million-tonnes-per-year rock quarry, but they're concerned nobody is listening.

title.children: Residents outraged by proposed quarry 'right in the middle' of estate

image.altText: A baggy green cricket cap with a crest and the years 1946-47 embroidered on the front.

props.synopsis: One of 11 known baggy green caps worn by Australian cricket great Sir Donald Bradman is bought by the National Museum of Australia for $438,550 at auction, with a federal government contribution covering half the cost.

title.children: Don Bradman's baggy green bought for over $400,000 by National Museum

image.altText: A man walks our of a building, he is looking down and wearing a suit and a face mask.

props.synopsis: A former Canberra childcare worker is found guilty of committing an act of indecency on a four-year-old boy at the daycare centre where he worked, as it is revealed he is already in jail for committing the same crime against a different boy.

title.children: Former childcare worker found guilty of indecently touching preschooler

image.altText: Sara holds her baby and smiles. The baby has a tube in her nose.

props.synopsis: After she started haemorrhaging at 22 weeks pregnant, Canberran Sara Batchelor and her daughter Rivah-Skye survived thanks to blood transfusions â€” and now the mother is urging Australians to roll up their sleeves.

title.children: Blood transfusions saved Rivah's life, but the type used is in short supply

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A convicted Canberra paedophile is jailed again after pleading guilty to repeat offences against a pair of young sisters, with the judge saying he has shown no remorse even after time in jail for similar offences.

title.children: Convicted paedophile back in jail for new offences against two sisters

image.altText: Liz is mid-speech, sitting behind a microphone in the studio. She has brown long hair and wears a denim shirt.

props.synopsis: Liz Allen says she has concerns about a group set up by the ANU to oversee an investigation into bullying allegations she has made against senior leaders, including Chancellor Julie Bishop.

title.children: ANU academic concerned about group overseeing bullying investigation

image.altText: Bek Gillespie

props.synopsis: A night out on Bek Gillespie's first holiday as a family with her two nine-month-old twins descended into a frightening situation when oneÂ daughter put her fingers into a bowl ofÂ dumpling sauce.

title.children: Allergies are costing Australia billions. Why are they increasing?

image.altText: A man getting dragged n a clash with police.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old has died after being struck by an armoured police vehicle during violent clashes at a Jakarta rally.

title.children: Protester dies after being run over by police in Indonesia

image.altText: Close up shot of a Aus Post express post package

props.synopsis: Australia Post's chief executive defends the postal carrier's decision to immediately halt most shipping to the United States, just four days before a tariff deadline on low-value packages arriving there came into play.

title.children: Australia Post warns of 'intensifying structural headwinds' despite small profit

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy, wearing a plain black jumper, speaks into a mic in front of an ornate background, next to a Ukrainian flag.

props.synopsis: Ukraine hasn't held a presidential election since 2019. International law experts say it's "ultimately not safe" until a peace agreement is reached with Russia.Â

title.children: Zelenskyy told Trump 'you can't have elections' during a war. Is this true?

image.altText: Human waste fills to the top of a plane toilet

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia has apologised after passengers on a flight from Bali to Brisbane overnight were left without any working toilets during what one described as "a filthy, humiliating nightmare".

title.children: 'One elderly woman wet herself': Passengers 'distressed' after plane's toilets stop working

image.altText: Mark Nawaqanitawase of the Roosters scores a try, diving and grounding with one hand

props.synopsis: Sydney winger Mark Nawaqanitawase has added to his highlight reel with another magnificent try to spark the Roosters in their Friday night clash with the Melbourne Storm. Follow live.

title.children: Nawaqanitawase scores another brilliant try to spark Roosters comeback

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 54' TRY: Roosters score under the posts
Warriors player Demitric Vaimauga speaks after controversial Bunker call

image.altText: A CCTV footage with a person in camoflague.

props.synopsis: New Zealand father Tom Philips disappeared into the rugged wilderness just before Christmas 2021 with his three children.

title.children: NZ fugitive reportedly caught on camera after four years on the run

image.altText: Melatonin gummies for sale online.

props.synopsis: Many Australian families use melatonin supplements to help their kids get a good night's sleep. But new data shows a concerning spike in overdoses among children taking the gummies.

title.children: US-based online retailer bans melatonin sales to Australia after jump in child overdoses

image.altText: Bob Katter doorstop

props.synopsis: Bob Katter's threat to punch a journalist over a question about his heritage has drawn criticism from senior MPs across the political spectrum, who say his colourful character is no justification for violent behaviour.

title.children: Politicians chastise Bob Katter's threats against journalist

image.altText: A woman in a grey and white blazer speaking at a podium to media.

props.synopsis: Amanda Camm was brought to tears in the chamber when discussing her childhood marred by family violence at the hands of her father for the first time.

title.children: Queensland minister tells of family DV experience in wake of new laws

image.altText: An aerial image of sheep and a tractor in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces an additional $1 billion for farm drought loans and commits to continuing the scheme beyond 2026.

title.children: Drought assistance extended with $1b for Victorian, SA farmers

image.altText: Two men at a podium in the Prime Minister's Courtyard.

props.synopsis: After months of painstaking investigation, Australia's top spooks last week unpicked the thread confirming a link between the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and antisemitic attacks in Sydney and Melbourne.Â

title.children: How Iran's antisemitic attack plot came undone

image.altText: A man holding a firearm smiling and wearing ear muffs

props.synopsis: An army reservist with access to high-powered firearms is found guilty of threatening a senior WA Police officer over his involvement in the state's firearm reforms.Â

title.children: Gun enthusiast who told police officer 'we're coming for you' faces jail

image.altText: Robbins Island, Tasmania

props.synopsis: A 100-turbine wind farm, the largest in Tasmania, will be built on Robbins Island in north-west Tasmania following seven delays to the decision, and multiple court appeals.

title.children: Robbins Island wind farm approved after years of delays

image.altText: Dave Hughes laying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Dave Hughes is rushed to hospital by his wife after coming in for some heavy contact during the AFL Legends game at Docklands Stadium.

title.children: 'He couldn't breathe': Dave Hughes ends up in hospital after AFL Legends game

image.altText: A downcast young AFL player with a bandage on his head leans against a wall next to a teammate.

props.synopsis: An examination of AFL premiership player Adam Hunter's brain, donated for research by his family, confirms he was suffering from chronic traumatic encephalopathy.

title.children: West Coast Eagles star posthumously diagnosed with CTE

image.altText: Dead globefish covered in sand on beach.

props.synopsis: Scientific efforts are getting microscopic on the biggest algal bloom in Australiaâ€™s history to see if it hides secrets that could stop its spread.

title.children: 'Frighteningly complex': Scientists race to find solution to algal crisis

image.altText: Caucasian man with a fair complexion with reddish /sandy hair and bluish-green eyes

props.synopsis: Maroochydore Magistrates Court hears a witness watched missing Brisbane man Andrew Burow being severely beaten on a video phone call.

title.children: Witness saw missing man beaten by 'weapons and instruments', court told

image.altText: A young man with a tattoo above his right eye takes a photo of himself.

props.synopsis: Prisoner Nicholas Aaron Scott was shot and killed by another man in a scuffle the morning after his escape from Royal Hobart Hospital, where he was meant to be handcuffed at all times.

title.children: Prison guard gave chase 'in socks' to hospital escapee

image.altText: People speaking outside court with one holding a placard reading 'truth will win in the end'

props.synopsis: A leading extremism expert says increasing inequality is leading to the growth of sovereign citizen and other fringe groups spreading across rural and regional Australia.

title.children: As the sovereign citizen movement grows, experts are watching regional Australia

image.altText: A young girl holds a phone in front of dozens of bunches of flowers, left in tribute to two children shot and killed.

props.synopsis: The parents of Harper Moyski, 10, and Fletcher Merkel, 8, have spoken about the pain of losing their children in yesterday's school shooting in Minneapolis, with Harper's parents urging leaders to take meaningful action on gun violence and mental health.Â

title.children: Parents of child killed in Minneapolis school shooting want gun action

image.altText: An aerial shot of a green rural property with a large herd of sheep on it.

props.synopsis: Telopea Downs in the state's north-east is offered for sale on a walk-in, walk-out basis, seven years after it was purchased for $70 million.Â

title.children: Victoria's largest farming property hits market for first time since 2018

image.altText: Daria Kasatkina pumps her right fist in celebration

props.synopsis: Daria Kasatkina records a stunning comeback win while fighting cramps to advance to the third round at the US Open as Jannik Sinner dismantles Alexei Popyrin and Alex de Minaur goes through.

title.children: Kasatkina overcomes cramps to advance in thriller, Popyrin out, De Minaur through

image.altText: Close up of couple touching on the leg

props.synopsis: People often feel alone in their intimacy struggles, but peek behind the curtain of sex therapy, and you may realise your concerns are not unique.Â

title.children: The most common issues these sex therapists see

image.altText: Aiva Anagnostiadis smiling has she put on her racing helmet in the team garage before a session in the F1 Academy

props.synopsis: It has been several weeks since Australian driver Aiva Anagnostiadis has been in a racing car but when she hits the track on Friday in the Netherlands, the Victorian will "switch something mentally" before putting her foot down.

title.children: Aiva is ready to flick the switch and put her foot down in Zandvoort

image.altText: Australian runner Jess Hull looks away as she crosses the line, with a Kenyan athlete winning out wide.

props.synopsis: Jess Hull has a tough finale to her bid to win a Diamond League title, miscalculating her 1,500m final charge to get pipped on the line.

title.children: Aussie star Jess Hull's Diamond League dream ends in tough finish

image.altText: A man and a woman hold hands over a diner table

props.synopsis: Starring Olivia Colman and Benedict Cumberbatch and written by Australian Tony McNamara, this re-imagining of this thorny novel stings.

title.children: Colman and Cumberbatch are joyfully venomous in Roses remake
